title: Lower Extremity Reconstruction Using Vastus Lateralis Myocutaneous Flap versus Anterolateral Thigh Fasciocutaneous Flap
patient: A 56-year-old male patient presented with a composite defect of the ankle due to a fall. After debridement, a 4×4 cm area of the calcaneus was exposed. We used a VL-MC flap with sufficient volume to cover the defect. Fourteen months after surgery, the flap survived well with a good contour. The functional outcome score was 3, and the cosmetic outcome score was 2.67 ().
